intro: Scabrethia scabra subsp. canescens, commonly known as the hairy scabrethia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
